newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean bank shares fall on ownership news.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean bank shares fall on ownership news.

text.p: South Korean banking shares fell 3.58 percent in afternoon trading on Tuesday after the finance ministry officially said it had decided to keep the current four percent ceiling on individual ownership in commercial banks.
The banking sub-index had shed 14.14 points to 380.91 at 0525 GMT.
Korea Exchange Bank lost 230 won to 6,150 and Housing and Commercial Bank shed 800 won to 15,200.
"The government has decided to maintain the ceiling on ownership in bank shares at the current four percent for the time being," a ministry statement said.

The decision was in contrast to an earlier proposal by the Presidential Commission for Financial Reform to expand the limit to 10 percent under certain conditions to enhance the competitiveness of the local banking industry.

"Investors were disappointed in the news the government will not expand the ceiling," said Park Sang-jae at Coryo Securities. "They had anticipated banking shares would come into the spotlight, if the ceiling expansion signals merger and acquisition bids in the banking industry."
Brokers forecast banking shares would remain weak for the time being.
